ai-sn17:38-43.1.3_0: When I’ve comprehended the mind of a certain person, I understand:
ai-sn17:38-43.1.4_0: ‘This venerable would not tell a deliberate lie even for the sake of their father. ...
ai-sn17:38-43.1.5_0: (This should be expanded as in the previous discourse.)
ai-sn17:38-43.1.8_0: ‘... for the sake of a son.’ ...
ai-sn17:38-43.1.10_0: ‘... for the sake of the wife.’
ai-sn17:38-43.1.11_0: After some time I see a deception by possessions, honor, and popularity.
ai-sn17:38-43.1.12_0: So brutal are possessions, honor, and popularity—bitter and harsh, an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
ai-sn17:38-43.1.13_0: So, mendicants, you should train like this:
ai-sn17:38-43.1.14_0: ‘We will give up arisen possessions, honor, and popularity, and we won’t occupy our minds.’
ai-sn17:38-43.1.15_0: ʻWe will do observance-day ceremonies that are legitimate and have a complete assembly.’”
ai-sn17:38-43.2.5_0: The Linked Discourses on possessions, honor, and popularity are complete.
